caption: Friendly service, good food !

Absolutely amazing food. To keep it simple- I’m first generation Italian. This is about as authentic as authentic can be. The Bolognese sauce is stellar! Their side dishes are wonderful. I’ve been here a handful of times and the meals have never disappointed. Don’t miss out on this spot!
Very good
Small place with outdoor seating right off of Arthur Ave, much more reasonably priced than other locations. Staff was very helpful with any questions I had.
The best Italian restaurant in the Bronx! Everything fresh and cooked to perfection with a great waiter and waitress staff that make it so friendly! A diamond in the rough!!!

Five stars for graciousness. My husband and I were supposed to have dinner at Tra Di Noi this evening with our cousins. They arrived about 20 minutes before our set time and called to say they were not comfortable with the patio set up being on the street with traffic going by. There are barriers between the tables and the street but it wasn't comfortable for them. I called to explain and cancel our reservation. Even though it was 15 minutes before we were scheduled to arrive, the person who answered the phone couldn't have been more understanding and kind when I explained to him why we wouldn't be there for dinner. He was exceedingly understanding and invited us to try again another time. I look forward to doing so, very much.
Outstanding place for delicious Italian food. i love going here. definitely worth a return trip. prices were good for how much you get. kinda of like a cafe in phoenix that i enjoyed.
Killer Italian
Excellent service.   Food came out fairly quickly and most importantly it was HOT.   The portions were normal size so there was no doggie bag for me.  Would definitely go back.
Food was delicious.
Great service...the food could be better.
Outstanding food and service!
The place serves large portions and for convenient rates. very friendly staff. Fantastic work.
Traditional Italian cooking at its finest.

This restaurant came highly recommended from a friend. I hadn't been to Arthur Avenue in 20 years. Very nice spot. Food was good. Service was excellent. I've been to better but this was a nice change.

We had such a good meal - classic Italian  clams oreganata, arugula salad, fried calamari, veal marsala, pasta with lamb ragu - with service like family. Wine was okay but everything else was stellar.
Amazing food and atmosphere.
Outstanding food, menu and service.  It doesn't get any better.

Amazing food. Amazing service. Had the veal marsala, carbonara, special chicken Francese over linguini and chicken scarpariello. Cheesecake for dessert. They were out of the nebbiolo we wanted but suggested an amazing wine in its place! Cant say eno ugh gh anout the family atmosphere, reasonable prices, and great menu!
I love this Restaurant ! One of my favorite on arthur Ave . Very good service

EXCELLENT SERVICE AND GREAT FOOD

Food and service fabulous

Food not as good as was told. Just okay. Soup very expensive. Small place so looks crowded and gives false impression of being a great place.

I had great friend refer me to this restaurant. They said go Sunday’s because they will seat without reservations. I walked in with 5 empty tables. It wasn’t busy either. We were told by the waiter to wait because they’re checking on  availability. About 5 min later a gentleman walks up to my family, looked like the owner or manager, & let us know nothing was available. Horrible.. I was very much looking forward to eating here & came with quiet an empty stomach.
Food was good
Amazing food. Nice ambiance. Incredible service.
Everything was good but felt like the hosts seemed a bit racist against people of certain races.
Best small Italian restaurant in Bronx's Little Italy!
Good food they had no sides like meatballs or sausage.

Food is ok but if they think you're not a local they might try to trick you. Arrived at 2.25 pm and they gave us the dinner menu without telling us charging dinner prices.. plus the owners were arguing in the restaurant which made us feel very very uncomfortable. Shame food is okay but totally overrated. The prices on the menu on the website are wrong, it is more expensive. Disappointed Big Time, I would have loved to love it.
I have been going here for about 2 years , Delicious food , Great Service and wonderful Owners.

Great atmosphere and fantastic food..... came from Canada.... and I can honestly say that the food is the same as my Italian mother makes.... and the pricing..... is just as good as the food..... I highly recommend this little Italian restaurant in the Bronx
Great food & great service
Very good price performance, and great service! Worth the trip from manhattan!

Im giving it a 1 star because when the bill came some of the prices were modified. My diet coke went from 3 to 6 somehow and the antipasti was 12 on the menu and 15 on my check the lasagna was nothing to brag about and neither was the service,  the owner was a super nice lady. Outside of that id pass on the food and go down the street to mangipasta

My son and his girlfriend, whom live in the neighborhood of this brilliant gem, brought my husband and I here for our birthdays.  From the moment we walked in the door you are greeted like family with smiles and genuine hospitality.  The joy that was brought to us (because calling it JUST food would diminish the smile our souls felt) was exceptional.  When the owners and staff brought out  the cake to us and sang happy birthday in Italian (yup to this Irish girl) my heart swelled and tears of love flowed.  I can not say enough for this little piece of heaven.  THANK YOU
They have the best food in the world
Excellent food! But their prices online are NOT accurate at all! Expect $20 per person minimum

Very good. Fresh.

I would give zero stars if I  could. My husband and I went to have a meal there.  The racist workers there  sat a party that came after us first.   We were told we would have to wait.   Never again will I  step food in a racist place where being a person of color means you get served after white counterparts.
The most authentic Italian food around. Dishes are so delightful and delicious! A welcoming and warm environment
Great food and prices, good ambiance and polite people.i went there alone to reflect on my dad's passing and it was quite peaceful.

Very disappointed. First time dining here. Three ordered veal pram... 2 small medallions with cold cut type mozzarella not the real deal. Other diner had veal with mushrooms which were canned. Not what one expects in little Italy. Service was terrible. Tried getting waiter's attention for 15 min to get the check. Will never go back. There are many other really good restaurants to dine in.
Reservations are strictly enforced on weekends

Tonight's meal was a throw back to the days when several Arthur Ave restaurants were like eating in Italy. Divine tenderest ever pork chop with vinegar peppers, baby chicken on bone with sausage arugula with salmon, lemoncello. Best meal anywhere in several years. Friendly helpful service and beautiful music.

Very disappointed with everything.  The food was okay but overpriced.  Had fish salad - it didn’t even fill the plate they served it on. Who serves food with empty spaces on the plate?  The baccala was very tough.  I asked for a dish to taste my friends food - the waitres answered “you have one”...really???   Nothing about the place would tempt me to give another try. So many better in the neighborhood.

2nd time I ate there in years. 1st time the food was delicious and the service was spot on. I ate there tonight and the food was passable at best. Nothing to brag about. Very disappointed. Service was not good! Disappointing experience!

The food was fresh but mediocre not worth the money.

The mozzarella caprese was great, the tomatoes fresh and the mozzarella very tasty. The highlight though was the lasagna. The dough is a thin as paper and there is no ricotta added. To quote our waitress “ricotta is for pizza”. Couldn’t agree more. Five stars!

If you find yourself around Arthur Ave seeking for a good Italian dinner, look no further than Tra Di Noi. From their daily specials to the staples on the menu- everything is delicious. I could come here 100x and never tire. Buon appetito!

Authentic Italian food in an authentic Italian environment. This isn't Little Italy for tourists. This is where savvy New Yorkers go who know what good Italian cooking tastes like. The person who waits on you isn't just a server or a waiter, but your host in the true generous meaning of that word.
One of the best Italian restaurants in Bronx Little Italy.

Service was ok, ambient ok, but food? Freaking 5 🌟,  first time I dont have an overwhelming flavorful or salty lasagna, this lasagna was perfect , it wasn't salty, meat had the perfect amount of sauce OMG. I'm coming back for sure. We also order a salad and fettuccine Alfredo I liked them both. It's all about consistency in the sauce. Thanks for the food.
Charming, small, classic Italian restaurant in decor and menu with the entrees written on a chalkboard. Everything from the bread to the entrees was absolutely delicious.

This is a very small family owned and operated restaurant. The menu is small with the daily specials written on the wall. The bread is not warm. They don't serve it with butter or the traditional oil and herbs. With that said, the food is phenomenal. If you ever have the chance to order the meatballs, they are amazing. The penne pasta is like no other. So far, everything on the menu has been great.

Went here with my boyfriend.  The food was good but the service was not up to my standards!

This place is classic, simple, Italian at its best. My friend and I went for lunch on a Sunday. We did not have a reservation but we were lucky to get a table because we showed up right when it opened. Fresh, warm bread came out right away. We split a bottle of red wine. We also split the house salad - which was large and ok - reminded us of Olive Garden salad. We both ordered chicken parm (wasn't on the menu but the waitress said they could make it). The chicken was so so tender and delicious. It came with a side of roasted potatoes and french cut green beans. Both were seasoned perfectly. My friend also ordered a side of linguine and I ordered two meatballs.... I think the meatballs were the best part. We ate as much as we could but, ultimately, had to take some home. That meal was an absolute gem! Can't wait to return.

Perhaps the worst I have ever been treated.  Should be zero stars.  Did not have a reservation 12:30 in the afternoon, we were 2 ladies   3 tables were filled,  after a brief conference with the waiter the waitress tried to seat the two of us at a table right in front of the door the size of a snack table.  They said all of the other tables were reserved, for 12:30, however there were no other people waiting.  We reluctantly sat there, before we ordered a group of 4 men came in and they did not have a reservation however the waiter agreed to seat them at a table in rear of the place that was not set for guests,  but then moved them to the front.  When I asked if we could sit at the table that he was going to give to the 4 men,  he refused. The waitress said “the food tastes  the same no matter where  you sit.  That might be true,  but we didn’t get to find out we left,  plenty of good food elsewhere. Very rude!
Very over priced
Great service and the owner chef is amazing!

If you're looking for a good place in Little Italy, this is a solid choice.  The Octopus salad is a great way to start and the Paccherri is made perfectly. The Chicken Scarpiello is not spicy hot at all. I prefer it with some hot peppers but nonetheless, it has real good flavor. Great cappucinno and the staff was a pleasure. They were all very nice. We will be back. To ensure there is a table for you, definitely book a reservation in advance. Friendly tip... finding parking in the entire area can be a challenge. Do not forget to feed the meter as its frequently patrolled by meter maids/police.
One of the best kept "secrets" on Arthur Ave and one of the best, most authentic restaurants up there.
Amazing food, everytime. Authentic, traditional, delicious, consistent.
Best Italian food in Arthur Ave area. They serve home cook meat on red and white table cloth. Don't forget to check daily special board.
Good red sauce. Nice space
Amazing food, oddly enough the green beans and potatoes were a hilight.
Best pasta I've ever had.

We just love Tra Di Noi...! Well worth the Metro North quick train ride to Fordham Station from NYC.  Make a reservation (or you can try to call the day of to do so, if you're dining early, 4 or 5) to not be disappointed... Their house salad is superb, citrus, olive oil: share!  All dishes are fresh, cooked to perfection and spiced perfectly.  It's kind and calm, unlike the other more well hyped Arthur Avenue spots.  If you order right away you'll be out the door too quick. Order a bottle of wine (no bar drinks due to their close proximity to Catholic Church) then an appetizer.  Go slow... servers are nice and attentive, but there is a little (unwarranted) pressure to turn tables, if you don't take control of the pace!  We have brought so many friends here, and all can't wait to return.   [By the way, don't even think about Little Italy downtown NYC, unless you want to be disappointed.]   Arthur Avenue is the only Little Italy that matters!  Mangia!
Fantastic food, and always a friendly welcome here. I return often, and I am never disappointed!
Great veal and fish dishes ...excellent wait staff and the owner is very nice. Pinot noir was an excellent choice.

This place was empty when we walked in, and the host asked us twice why the group of five of us hadn't made reservations. Not a great start. the appetizers were delicious, including the burrata mozzarella and calamari salad. Some of us enjoyed our entrees more than others. My scallops were just okay, but my aunt loved her osso bucco, and my uncle enjoyed his branzino. We also had the pasta a in pink crab sauce, which was okay, but too creamy and without crab flavor
Stay away from this place.  Very poor , racist service.  Rude, extremely inconsiderate staff
Super trattoria.   Like being back in Brooklyn. If you eat Trippa, you won't find a  better preparation.   All dishes wonderful.

The food was at best mediocre and the service was terrible. At least fifteen minutes to get a menu. Stay away from the chicken alla parmigiana.  The sauce tasted canned and it came with nothing but a mediocre piece of chicken. No pasta, no sides.
(Translated by Google) What good linguine with clams! Thank you!  (Original) Che buone le linguine con le vongole! Grazie!

(Translated by Google) the place is not bad as perol decoration to food is terrible and the service too. I am Italian and ate at many good restaurant. This is the worst of all. Unhelpful waiters high prices. Good...

It was our lucky day that after visiting the zoo we happen to exit on the Southern Blvd/Belmont neighborhood side. We were headed up to the Botanical Gardens but we were starving. After a quick Yelp I noticed a bunch of restaurants in the area. "Hmmm" I said, " Seems to be a lot of Italian restaurants"   Well, not only did we stumble upon Bronx Little Italy (NY's better one) but on Trattoria Tra di Noi and a nice day just got better.  Hubby and I have a habit of sharing so we can try more new dishes. So I ordered the Fettuccine Carbonara and hubby ordered the Pollo alla Scarpariello ( chicken w/Rosemary,white wine & garlic) which came with potatoes and French cut string beans.  Both dishes were very, very good.  The carbonara ( with fresh fettuccine al dente) had a nice light sauce, not the overly creamy sauce that most other places serve. The bacon was rough chopped and meaty. The Scarpariello was excellent!! The chicken medallions were lightly dredged in flour and perfectly sautéed in the wine sauce that had chopped red peppers with whole cloves of garlic and rosemary.  The potatoes seemed to have been roasted but left tender and the string beans lightly streamed.  I also had a cappuccino and that very good as well. We had come at the tail end of a busy Sunday lunch so it was a bit crowed.  Regardless, service was good with water filling and follow up.  What I really liked was that a few people who came in and some of the tables that were already there were greeted warmly by name showing to me that this establishment is part of a close neighborhood where the owners, workers and patrons live amongst each other.  That warmed my heart, and made me vow to come back soon to both Tra di Noi and the Belmont/Little Italy neighborhood.

Based on what I've eaten here, Tra di Noi is probably the most underrated restaurant on Arthur Ave.  Well not really, since it's about a block off Arthur Ave next to Egidio's, but you get the point.  They've been Michelin recommended--yes, apparently they do make it to the Bronx--for several years.  Based on that and bits of positive chatter that I'd heard for awhile, the first time I went I had decided to break from the normal diet of Mario's and Roberto's/089 to try something new.  The place is pretty small, having only ~15 tables, one bus boy, one waiter, and an owner or 2 acting as hosts.  Except for the bus boy and maybe 1 or 2 guys helping in the kitchen, everything working there was Italian.  Regardless of staffing, service was effective, friendly and helpful.  Decor is very simple and there were red checkered tablecloths for those that are fans (I am).  That would normally imply a much more casual, lower quality establishment.  But in the middle of the left wall was all you needed to see to know that the place is serious: a specials menu 15-20 items long.  Sure, they have a menu of classic Italian American dishes that you can order and they'll be great.  But the specials menu is where your attention really should be.  The biggest negative for Tra di Noi is the lack of a full bar.  Wine list looked like it had some good options though, and while it wasn't listed they do offer a house wine.  Beer list, like at most Italian places, is thoroughly mediocre.  Somebody needs to tell these restaurants that there is good beer in Italy now, and that you can pair it with Italian food.  The girl wanted clams, so we got baked clams.  The clams were small, tender and flavorful.  A bit annoying that we only got 7, but the $10 price point was good.  They used a bit too much breadcrumbs for my taste though, and they weren't very crispy either.  The sauce underneath the clams seemed to be francese which was an interesting twist.  My red snapper marachiare special was great.  The filet was sizable, perfectly cooked and flavorful.  The sauce it was in wasn't the kind of marachiare I was used to in that it wasn't cooked with clams; in principle it was still a marechiare, being a mix of the light tomato sauce of a red clam sauce with the white wine and garlic of a white clam sauce, just minus the clams.  Technicalities aside, it was subtle, delicious and complemented the fish perfectly.  This was $27, and was totally worth it.  My girlfriend liked her chicken scarpariello a lot.  She got it on the bone and it was a great rendition of this classic, with a sizable portion to boot.  I liked how they chopped up and added vinegar peppers while cooking, rather than just throwing them in whole with the dish.  The one piece of chicken I got could've been a bit crisper and juicier, but all the right flavors were there.  These dishes come with potatoes and whatever greens they have, which ended up being green beans.  I usually hate green beans as much as the hiccups--and I hate the hiccups--but these I actually enjoyed.  They were just sauteed with a little olive oil and garlic; simple and delicious.  The potatoes were just small potatoes that were cut into quarters and baked with a little rosemary.  They were crisp and tasty.  I wanted to try their base tomato sauce, so we ended up getting a side of linguini with marinara as well.  The pasta was perfectly al dente as request, and the tomato sauce--contrary to most of the Italian American places nearby--was fresh and light.  Every other meal I've had here has been great as well.  Whether you're new to the area or are a veteran, give this place a shot and I doubt you'll be disappointed.

Tra Di Noi is wonderful Italian food in the Bronx Belmont neighborhood (Little Italy) that has plenty of decent Italian. The decor is simple if not traditional (think red checked tablecloths). The service is quite attentive. The chef is modest, understated and at times brilliant in his preparation of dishes old and new. The pastas are great and the seafood dishes even more so. Highly recommended.
Fresh from the market food. Bought fresh in the morning and cooked that night. The soups are amazing!!!!

We have eaten here so many times and have never been disappointed.  And, we have brought different friends each time and all love it.  My Italian friend said that the marinara sauce was the best she ever had.  We all agreed with her on that.  And, another friend said that the osso bucco was also the best he ever had.  And, I just love the chicken and sausage scarpiello. The menu is limited; but that is probably what keeps each dish being so good.  Veggies and potatoes are served family style. Reservations are recommended for a Friday or Saturday night since the restaurant is small.
just a few dishes, perfectly prepared. absolutely delicious.
